allWebinar.title: Using visual representations: enhance learning and understanding in mathematics

video.title: Webinar: Using visual representations: enhance learning and understanding in mathematics

children.text: Oak's Maths Subject Lead, Ed Southall, takes an in-depth look at the effective use of visual representations in mathematics.
The use of visual representation across primary and secondary mathematics to help develop conceptual understanding of abstract topics.
Useful models to make explanations of the four operations and other areas of maths more easy to grasp for students.
Interesting tools such as double number lines, area and bar models.

allWebinar.title: What weâ€™ve learnt about online learning and what it means for the future of education

video.title: Webinar: What weâ€™ve learnt about online learning and what it means for the future of education

children.text: In this webinar, we discuss new research that looks at how teachers and pupils are using Oak, and what we've learnt about remote teaching.

Oak launched just under 18 months ago to provide remote lessons for teachers and pupils during lockdown. Our platform has grown to host over 10,000 lessons, with pupils having now taken part in more than 130 million lessons. Oak has been used by 58% of all schools - used extensively for lesson planning, in-class teaching and cover, as well as remote provision. 

Our second annual report documents our progress, drawing on an evaluation of our impact by ImpactEd.
A deep dive into research on how both children and teachers are using the  platform.
Current evidence on what makes for effective online or blending learning for pupils is thin on the ground, with the expansion of digital resources far outpacing research.
Chaired by Nicola Woolcock, Education Editor at The Times, speaker include:
Matt Hood, Principal, Oak National Academy
Reka Budai, Research & Evaluation Manager, Oak National Academy
Natalie Perera, Chief Executive, Education Policy Institute

allWebinar.title: Planning for the new school year with Oak National Academy

video.title: Webinar: Planning for the new school year with Oak National Academy

children.text: Last year was tough, but that doesn't mean starting this year with a blank page. Instead, start it with a bustling library of everything you'll need for a full year of teaching.

Whether you're a new teacher starting from scratch or an experienced teacher updating schemes for a new set of pupils, Oak National Academy is a consistent source of inspiration and teaching materials to support you from the second you set foot back in the classrooom.
In this webinar, we talk you through the latest developments at Oak and show how we can support you in the classroom in the coming year.
How to make best of use of our Teacher Hub to support in-class teaching.
Our new and improved curriculum maps to support planning.
Improvements to our quizzes and lesson slides, including more downloadable resources, to support lesson delivery.

allWebinar.title: Lessons for ITT: Supporting trainee teachers in 2021

video.title: Webinar: Lessons for ITT: Supporting trainee teachers in 2021

children.text:
Teachers entering the profession over the past year have had a training year like no other. The disruption has not only impacted on the learning and development of pupils, but of those training to teach them.

So, to help our newest colleagues, weâ€™ve created a set of video resources to support trainee teachers. With access to in-person observations limited, weâ€™re tapping into the collective expertise of the teachers who created lessons for Oak to provide an opportunity for trainees to not only observe lessons, but to understand the thinking and decisions that go into making them. These lesson videos for ITT are intended to exemplify key elements of the ITT Core Content Framework (CCF).
